{"step_by_step_thinking": "The coagulation pathway, also known as the clotting cascade, is a complex process that involves a series of steps and the activation of various clotting factors. The sequence of clotting factors in the coagulation pathway is initiated by Factor XII (Hageman factor). This is followed by Factor XI (plasma thromboplastin antecedent), then Factor IX (Christmas factor), and finally Factor X (Stuart-Prower factor).", "answer_choice": "C"}
